intro: Hieracium gallicum, commonly known as the French hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragweed, and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are upright and branched. Hieracium gallicum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
